qas.question: Based on year 2000 data, where is GE ranked among the largest corporate producers of air pollution in the US?
How many tons of toxic chemicals does GE release into the atmosphere each year?
According to which government agency is GE a leading producer of Superfund toxic waste sites?
Which two commercial businesses produce more Superfund toxic waste sites than GE?
Which organization identified GE as the fourth largest corporate producer of air pollution in the US?
How much air pollution is spewed out by all of the Superfund toxic waste sites each year?
How much air pollution in Chevron Corporation responsible for each year?
Who is the largest corporate producer of air pollution each year?
Who did the Political Economy Research Institute list as the third-largest producer of air pollution?
How much air pollution did GE create in 1980?

context: GE has a history of some of its activities giving rise to large-scale air and water pollution. Based on year 2000 data, researchers at the <a4_0>Political Economy Research Institute<a4_0/> listed the corporation as the <a0_0>fourth-largest<a0_0/> corporate producer of air pollution in the United States, with more than <b5_0><b6_0>4.4 million pounds<b6_0/><b5_0/> per year (<a1_0><b9_0>2,000<a1_0/> tons<b9_0/>) of toxic chemicals released into the air. GE has also been implicated in the creation of toxic waste. According to <a2_0>EPA<a2_0/> documents, only the <b8_0>United States Government<b8_0/>, <a3_0>Honeywell, and <b7_0>Chevron Corporation<b7_0/><a3_0/> are responsible for producing more Superfund toxic waste sites.
